definition: to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: His mature compositions are generally considered the more cerebral and crabbed .
sentences.chinese: 他成熟的作品一般被認爲是觸動理智的和難於理解的。

sentences.english: A true friend is someone who reaches for your hand and touches your heart.
sentences.chinese: 一個真正的朋友是向著你伸手，觸動你心靈的人。

sentences.english: But the S.& P. action hit a nerve.
sentences.chinese: 然而，標普的行動卻觸動了神經。

sentences.english: The story of their sufferings moved us deeply.
sentences.chinese: 他們苦難的經歷深深地觸動了我們。

sentences.english: Tapping on the hive excited the bees.
More power is needed to actuate a relay than to maintain a given state.
sentences.chinese: 需要更大的功率才能夠觸動繼電器並維持給定的狀態。

sentences.english: I am often struck by new phrases that are profoundly meaningful and melodic.
sentences.chinese: 一些意義深遠，音調優美的詞組經常觸動着我。

sentences.english: My love, I have hungered for you touch a long time.
sentences.chinese: 我的愛情，我都想象和你觸動了很長的時間。

sentences.english: Feng’s photos taken with an old camera have touched the hearts of many Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 馮英龍用舊相機拍的照片，觸動了衆多中國人的心靈。

sentences.english: When I pull up just the vibrations are enough to set me off.
sentences.chinese: 如果震動太強，要觸動我了，我就把車停到路邊。

sentences.english: Deep within their souls, a memory was stirred. Something was touched and set in motion.
sentences.chinese: 他們靈魂深處的記憶甦醒了過來，似乎有所觸動。

sentences.english: One thing and one thing only concerned my soul.
sentences.chinese: 只有一件事，一件觸動到我靈魂的事。

sentences.english: It touches every aspect of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 它觸動了我們生活的方方面面。

sentences.english: The words touched the very core of her heart.
sentences.chinese: 這些話觸動了她內心深處。

sentences.english: Raided and personal letter touched the nerve of cadres.
sentences.chinese: 突襲檢查和親筆信觸動了幹部的神經。

definition: to affect/to produce a change in sth
immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
to pass on/to convey/to relay/to transmit/transmission
